article:
I often watched a little girl playing basketball on the playground near my house. She would _ shooting over and over again, sometimes until dark. One day I asked her _ she practiced so hard. She said,"I like basketball. I want to play for the top basketball team. I want to be the _ . My daddy told me if the dream is big enough,the facts don't count . "
I watched her _ those high school years. One day, I saw her sitting on the grass,head in her arms. I walked to her and asked what was wrong. "Oh,nothing, " she said. "I am just not that tall. " The coach told her that she was too _ to play for a top team. She was very _ . I asked her if she had talked to her _ about it yet. She told me that her father said those coaches were _ .They just did not understand the power of a _ .He told her that nothing could _ her but one thing-her own attitude -if she really wanted to play for a good basketball team. He told her again,"If the dream is big enough, the facts don't count. " The next year, she was asked to join the NCAA women's basketball team.
